definitions: the action of making or declaring something, typically a church, sacred

examples.text: the consecration of this cathedral was a magical event

shortDefinitions: act of making or declaring something sacred

definitions: (in Christian belief) the action of declaring bread and wine to be or represent the body and blood of Christ

examples.text: the consecration of bread and wine in the Eucharist

shortDefinitions: (in Christian belief) act of declaring bread and wine to be or represent body and blood of Christ

definitions: the action of ordaining someone to a sacred office, typically that of bishop

examples.text: he received consecration as bishop at Notre Dame

shortDefinitions: act of ordaining someone to a sacred office
